entry.title: Evergrowing
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 149,678Chapters: 25/?Kudos: 17

Summary: Athena and Bobby are learning that parenting doesn’t end when the kids turn eighteen. With three grown children and two still at home, Bobby and Athena find themselves navigating new challenges at every stage of life. Each child carries their own struggles, some spoken and some hidden, but together the family works through the ups and downs with love, patience, and resilience. At the heart of it all, they’re reminded that family is a bond that grows, shifts, and deepens, no matter how old the kids get.

  • No Archive Warnings Apply

entry.title: Second Chances
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 166,305Chapters: 25/?Kudos: 44

Summary: Bobby and Athena are just two people trying to put their lives back together while figuring out how to co-parent. What starts as a complicated plan to foster kids in need slowly turns into something much deeper. Through the ups and downs of heartbreak, healing, and raising children who’ve been through so much, they find strength in each other. Over time, their partnership grows into love, and together, they build a story about family, trust, and second chances.

entry.title: The Price of Power
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 137,326Chapters: 23/?Kudos: 18

Summary: Athena Carter and Bobby Nash couldn’t be more different. She’s the disciplined “good girl” with her future mapped out, while he’s the dangerous bad boy with one foot in college and the other in the streets. When their worlds start to collide, what begins as a bitter rivalry quickly sparks into something deeper neither of them can ignore. But falling for Bobby means stepping into a world Athena never imagined, one ruled by loyalty and violence. That tested everything she thought she knew about herself. As sparks turn to fire, Athena must decide if love is worth the risk of losing everything.

entry.title: Everything You Lose Is A Step You Take
entry.summary:
Author: becauseevann

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 816Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 1

Summary: Buck was thrown to the floor, grunting in pain as his shoulder smacked against it. He instantly started feeling around, searching for anything that may help him free his tightly bound wrists and ankles. All he felt was cold, hard concrete. He could feel something soft covering his eyes—definitely a blindfold. He huffed in frustration, pushing his feet away from him to prop himself up against a wall. He rested his head against the cool stone, mentally running through his SERE training. Survive. Evade. Resist. Escape. He was certain he could survive. He was confident he could evade their questions. He was sure he could resist. He just didn’t know how he would escape. OR Buck is a Navy SEAL and Eddie is an army medic.

entry.summary:
Author: Graceful_Ashes

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,393Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 43

Summary: 𝑇ℎ𝑒𝑖𝑟 𝑙𝑖𝑣𝑒𝑠 𝑎𝑟𝑒 𝑖𝑛𝑡𝑒𝑟𝑡𝑤𝑖𝑛𝑒𝑑, 𝑖𝑛𝑒𝑥𝑡𝑟𝑖𝑐𝑎𝑏𝑙𝑦 𝑠𝑜. 𝐼𝑡'𝑠 𝑎 𝑡𝑟𝑢𝑡ℎ 𝐸𝑑𝑑𝑖𝑒 𝑘𝑛𝑜𝑤𝑠 𝑓𝑢𝑛𝑑𝑎𝑚𝑒𝑛𝑡𝑎𝑙𝑙𝑦. 𝐼𝑡'𝑠 𝑎 𝑔𝑟𝑜𝑢𝑛𝑑𝑖𝑛𝑔 𝑓𝑎𝑐𝑡 𝑎𝑏𝑜𝑢𝑡 ℎ𝑖𝑠 𝑎𝑛𝑑 𝐵𝑢𝑐𝑘’𝑠 𝑟𝑒𝑙𝑎𝑡𝑖𝑜𝑛𝑠ℎ𝑖𝑝. 𝑇ℎ𝑒𝑦'𝑟𝑒 𝑏𝑒𝑠𝑡 𝑓𝑟𝑖𝑒𝑛𝑑𝑠 𝑜𝑛 𝑡ℎ𝑒 𝑝𝑟𝑒𝑐𝑖𝑝𝑖𝑐𝑒 𝑜𝑓 𝑠𝑜𝑚𝑒𝑡ℎ𝑖𝑛𝑔 𝑚𝑜𝑟𝑒 𝑎𝑛𝑑 ℎ𝑒'𝑠 𝑖𝑛 𝑛𝑜 𝑟𝑢𝑠ℎ 𝑡𝑜 𝑝𝑢𝑠ℎ 𝑡ℎ𝑒𝑚 𝑖𝑛𝑡𝑜 𝑢𝑛𝑐ℎ𝑎𝑟𝑡𝑒𝑑 𝑤𝑎𝑡𝑒𝑟𝑠. 𝑇ℎ𝑒𝑦'𝑙𝑙 𝑓𝑖𝑛𝑑 𝑡ℎ𝑒𝑖𝑟 𝑤𝑎𝑦 𝑡ℎ𝑒𝑟𝑒 𝑒𝑣𝑒𝑛𝑡𝑢𝑎𝑙𝑙𝑦, 𝑖𝑡'𝑠 𝑖𝑛𝑒𝑣𝑖𝑡𝑎𝑏𝑙𝑒. 𝑆𝑜 𝐵𝑢𝑐𝑘 𝑐𝑎𝑛 𝑑𝑎𝑡𝑒 𝑜𝑡ℎ𝑒𝑟 𝑝𝑒𝑜𝑝𝑙𝑒 𝑓𝑜𝑟 𝑛𝑜𝑤, ℎ𝑒 𝑐𝑎𝑛 ℎ𝑎𝑣𝑒 ℎ𝑖𝑠 𝑓𝑢𝑛. 𝐸𝑑𝑑𝑖𝑒, 𝑤𝑜𝑛'𝑡 𝑠𝑝𝑜𝑖𝑙 𝑡ℎ𝑎𝑡 𝑓𝑜𝑟 ℎ𝑖𝑚. 𝐼𝑛 𝑡ℎ𝑒 𝑒𝑛𝑑, 𝐵𝑢𝑐𝑘 𝑎𝑙𝑤𝑎𝑦𝑠 𝑐𝑜𝑚𝑒𝑠 ℎ𝑜𝑚𝑒 𝑡𝑜 ℎ𝑖𝑚. 𝑂𝑟 𝐵𝑢𝑐𝑘 𝑎𝑛𝑑 𝐸𝑑𝑑𝑖𝑒 𝑎𝑟𝑒 𝑙𝑖𝑣𝑖𝑛𝑔 𝑡𝑜𝑔𝑒𝑡ℎ𝑒𝑟 𝑎𝑛𝑑 𝐵𝑢𝑐𝑘 ℎ𝑎𝑠 𝑠𝑡𝑎𝑟𝑡𝑒𝑑 𝑑𝑎𝑡𝑖𝑛𝑔 𝑎𝑔𝑎𝑖𝑛. 𝐸𝑑𝑑𝑖𝑒 𝑟𝑒𝑎𝑙𝑖𝑠𝑒𝑠 ℎ𝑒'𝑠 𝑖𝑛 𝑙𝑜𝑣𝑒 𝑤𝑖𝑡ℎ 𝐵𝑢𝑐𝑘 𝑎𝑛𝑑 𝑡𝑎𝑘𝑒𝑠 𝑡ℎ𝑒 𝑡𝑖𝑚𝑒 𝑡𝑜 𝑤𝑜𝑟𝑘 𝑡ℎ𝑟𝑜𝑢𝑔ℎ ℎ𝑖𝑠 𝑓𝑒𝑒𝑙𝑖𝑛𝑔𝑠 - 𝑛𝑜𝑡 𝑎𝑡 𝑎𝑙𝑙 𝑡ℎ𝑟𝑒𝑎𝑡𝑒𝑛𝑒𝑑 𝑏𝑦 ℎ𝑖𝑠 𝑏𝑒𝑠𝑡 𝑓𝑟𝑖𝑒𝑛𝑑'𝑠 𝑙𝑜𝑣𝑒𝑟𝑠. (Possibly a temporary summary)

entry.title: Late Night Love Confessions
entry.summary:
Author: Buddie_Butterflies

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,657Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 47

Summary: Knocking on the Han door at midnight was not his most brilliant move, Eddie realizes as he stands there, and then the door opens, and a very sleepy Maddie is standing before him. “Buck, what's wrong now?” she asks as she opens the door, her eyes shut, rubbing them. “This was a mistake,” Eddie says as he realizes what he has done. Eddie had always gone to Bobby, his captain, for advice, and Bobby was now gone. Chimney was the new captain, so by Eddie’s logic, he could now turn to him; he had not thought about who Chimney was married to. Maddie stands there, her eyes wide with surprise, when she realizes it isn’t Buck. “Eddie, it’s not a mistake. Sorry, I thought you were Buck. Please come in.” Eddie walks in as Chimney comes walking into the living room from the bedroom. “Eddie, you ok?” he asks, concerned. “Sorry, used to go to Bobby when he was captain. Sorry I woke you guys, I will let you get back to sleep,” he goes to turn when Maddie grabs his arm. “Eddie, nope, you woke us up, now you're stuck with us. Whatever you say here stays between us, even if it’s about Buck.” Maddie tells him, and Eddie can’t help but feel like he just got clocked.

entry.title: two-hand touch, full contact
entry.summary:
Author: the118forever

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,519Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 71

Summary: “Oh my God,” Eddie says, folding over in a fit of laughter. “Is this– is this your football jersey from college?” He doubles over in laughter again, the jersey hanging precariously from his fingertips. “Yes,” Buck hisses as he snatches the jersey out of Eddie’s hands, his cheeks burning crimson. “C’mon, you have to try it on for me, sweetheart,” Eddie replies after catching his breath. His hands sit on his hips, and Buck has to blink his eyes back into focus—away from the thoughts of the bite marks hidden underneath Eddie’s waistband from the night before. “Gimme a twirl,” Eddie adds as Buck looks at him blankly.Or, Buck has some memorabilia, and Eddie discovers a new kink.

entry.title: Nobody’s Son
entry.summary:
Author: Temptedtantrum

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,920Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 25

Summary: It’s 8:38 pm in California and Bobby Nash is dead. Bobby Nash, the man who was Evan’s surrogate father. Tommy’s realized since the break up that he didn’t fully understand Evan, but he did know some of him, at least. He’s always known this. He’s always know the way Evan looked up to Bobby, admired him, and went to him for advice. He knows the specific way that Evan doesn’t talk to his biological father, at least not more than a few passing words under the guise of niceties. Tommy watches Evan break down on the security camera and knows what he has to do next. He’ll give himself two more minutes and then he’ll do it. Two minutes to pretend that he’s the one Evan needs, that he can be the one who gets him through this. But he’s not, and he can’t. At 9:40 pm in El Paso, Eddie’s phone rings.~~~~~ Or, Tommy calls Eddie and tells him to get his ass to LA. Everything changes. (Was originally going to be Buddie but I started redeeming Tommy for plot reasons and I think it’s a why choose now. Idk. I’ll update tags as appropriate)

Summary: Hen stares at Buck for a long moment, then turns on her heel to walk upstairs. “Chim! Did you know that Peanut is a human child and not a small animal?” “Buck’s Peanut?” Chim calls back, leaning over the railing. “No? Is she not a dog?” “No!” Buck replies. “She’s a preschooler!”  OR: At 22, Buck got one of his hookups pregnant and decided to keep the baby himself rather than let her be put up for adoption.
